action.action-desc: Mr. Schrader (for himself and Mr. Welch) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to compel manufacturers to correct inaccurate classification data reported to the Medicaid rebate program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Medicaid Drug Rebate Accountability Act.

section.header: Authority to compel manufacturers to correct inaccurate classification data reported to Medicaid rebate program
section.text: Section 1927(b)(3) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396râ€“8(b)(3)) is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.header: Remedy with respect to inaccurate classification data

clause.text: In the case that the Secretary determines that drug classification data reported on or after September 30, 2018, by a manufacturer under this paragraph, with respect to a covered outpatient drug of such manufacturer, provides an inaccurate classification for such drug, the Secretary shall require such manufacturer to correct, within a 30-day period, the classification for such drug.

In the case of a manufacturer who fails to correct the classification of a covered outpatient drug within a 30-day period pursuant to clause (i), the Secretary shall, beginning the day after the end of such 30-day period, require such manufacturer to pay a civil monetary penalty of $100,000 per day until the date on which the manufacturer corrects such classification.
